image.altText: an elderly man in a colourful shirt

props.synopsis: Amid wider concerns about aged care sector fees, there are calls for more transparency to be introduced to retirement villages across the ACT.

title.children: 'A black hole': Calls for Canberra's retirement villages to be more transparent

image.altText: A wild koala in the fork of a gum tree.

props.synopsis: ACT government conservation officers have confirmed the first sighting of a wild koala in the territory since 2021, near the developing northern suburb of Jacka.

title.children: 'Pretty special': ACT's first confirmed wild koala sighting in three years

image.altText: Children play at a water park on a sunny and warm day.

props.synopsis: As Australia heads towards another record-breaking summer, urban heat experts share how we can better cool our cities and ourselves and mitigate against heat island effects.

title.children: Why Australians living in 'heat islands' will feel record summer temperatures worse than others

image.altText: A photographer kneels while taking a photo of Laura Nuttall outside the ACT Legislative Assembly.

props.synopsis: As electoral comebacks go, Greens MLA Laura Nuttall's is among the more remarkable. The Greens are now weighing up whether to sit on the cross-bench, or rejoin a Labor-led cabinet.

title.children: The final ACT election results are in, and include a political comeback that could shake up the legislative assembly

image.altText: A man and woman hugging in front of a for sale sign at a house

props.synopsis: Each generation has had its own unique struggles with first-home ownership. But which has had it the worst? Experts say it has little to do with smashed avo.

title.children: Lazy millennials to lucky boomers: The generational struggles with first-home ownership

image.altText: Ty stands on a soccer pitch with soccer goal in the distance

props.synopsis: People often avoid the topics of death and cancer around Ty, but he doesn't ask them to.

title.children: Speaking about his mother's death helps Ty grieve, but people keep avoiding the topic

image.altText: Light beams from a twisting silver sculpture with a wide opening outside an art gallery at night.

props.synopsis: Lindy Lee's sculpture Ouroboros, based on the ancient tale of the same name about a snake swallowing its own tail, is the National Gallery of Australia's largest ever investment in a single artwork.

title.children: National Gallery of Australia's single most expensive artwork Ouroboros unveiled to the public

image.altText: Men and children pull the Uiver aircraft out of the mud at Albury

props.synopsis: Margaret Atchison could be the last person still alive who saw a Dutch aircraft in southern NSW skies before residents helped it land safely 90 years ago.

title.children: How a country NSW town scrambled to save a stricken plane from tragedy

image.altText: Thousands of naked people standing on a city bridge, facing away from the camera so their bare bums are visible.

props.synopsis: A sea of naked bodies posed on Brisbane's Story Bridge as the sun rose on Sunday morning, participating in the latest public art project by New York-based photographer Spencer Tunick.

title.children: Thousands of naked people descend on Brisbane's Story Bridge in the name of art

image.altText: white elderly man wearing suit and glasses speaking at an event

props.synopsis: A person protesting against the Gaza war heckles US President Joe Biden as he formally apologises to Native Americans for the US's role in running abusive boarding schools for more than a century.

title.children: Biden apology to Native American children interrupted by Gaza war protester

image.altText: Live traffic screen shot of the are impacted by a crash

props.synopsis: A multi-vehicle crash closes the M1 Pacific Motorway on the New South Wales Central Coast.

title.children: Delays on M1 following four vehicle crash at Wyong

image.altText: Mitchell Moses and Tom Dearden celebrate a try in a Kangaroos Test.

props.synopsis: The Jillaroos keep New Zealand to nil for the first time in women's rugby league Test history, before the Kangaroos get revenge over the Kiwis in the Pacific Championships.

title.children: Debutant's Dream Shake gives Kiwis hope, but Mitchell Moses breaks their hearts

image.altText: A woman with a bandaged face and headdress is in the foreground of a dirty hospital room with people on the floor

props.synopsis: Israeli forces withdraw from a hospital complex in northern Gaza, with the Palestinian enclave's health ministry saying troops had detained dozens of male medical staffers and some patients.

title.children: Israeli army detains medics at northern Gaza hospital, according to health ministry

image.altText: National Guard in riot gear with shields line up in front of the Capitol building at night

props.synopsis: American voters on both sides hate the feedback loop that is creating more polarisation with each election. So why is change so elusive?

title.children: The feedback loop that leaves Americans hating their own democracy

image.altText: A mobile crane arm in front of a building with a fire breaking out on one side.

props.synopsis: Russian missile strikes killed seven people in Ukraine overnight, including two in Kyiv and five in Dnipro, Ukrainian officials said on Saturday.

title.children: Seven killed in Russian attacks on Ukraine as world leaders express 'grave concern' over North Korean troops in Russia

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera with the coast behind her

props.synopsis: After baby Valley died at just nine weeks old her mother Elle wanted to find a way to help others fight the challenges of rare childhood disorders and cancer. Together with another young mum, she succeeded.

title.children: When Elle's world stopped after the death of her baby, she found a way to honour her loss and save lives

image.altText: A young man with dark medium length hair poses for a photo smiling wearing a black hoody and puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: WA's P-plate drivers will be banned from carrying more than one passenger in their first six months behind the wheel, under changes announced by the State Government.

title.children: 'Peace of mind for parents': WA P-Plate drivers limited to one passenger from December under 'Tom's Law'

image.altText: Hands on a black jacket with a NSW Police patch

props.synopsis: A former sergeant with the NSW Police has told the ABC about their experience of homophobia while serving, including hearing "extremely homophobic" remarks during Sydney WorldPride 2023.

title.children: 'He spat in my face': Former NSW Police sergeant alleges 'horrific' homophobia throughout service

image.altText: A close-up of an eastern brown snake -- you can see its large black eye and irregular brown scales

props.synopsis: Snake season is upon us and experts say how you respond in the minutes after a bite could be the difference between life and death.

title.children: Some dropped rubbish left Cassy with a snake bite. What she did next saved her life

image.altText: Richard White rings bell at the Australian Stock Exchange in Sydney.

props.synopsis: WiseTech is not the only publicly-listed company to face allegations of bad behaviour. Big investors are now asking if corporate boards are doing enough to hold executives to account.

title.children: Boards investigate scandal-hit bosses but continue to stand by their man

image.altText: A creek with water flowing

props.synopsis: Personal trainer Jack McLennan disappeared on October 4 after a boy's trip to a campground in southern Queensland. Now, as a police search is scaled down, his family fears the worst.

title.children: This tranquil fishing spot has become the centre of 'something seriously bad'

image.altText: Graphic depicts author Han Kang looking serious in front of a historic photo of a tank

props.synopsis: The inspiration for the Korean author's book Human Acts stems from a devastating massacre in Gwangju over 40 years ago, but the ripple effects are still being felt today.

title.children: The real-life events behind Nobel Laureate Han Kang's haunting novel

image.altText: Kate's Berry Farm exterior of buildings.

props.synopsis: After Kate Bradley "started life again" at age 43 in Tasmania, she decided to plant berries and sell ice cream. Thirty-five years on, after much success (and false starts), she looks back with pride — and is ready to move on from the business she built, much of it by her own hands.

title.children: After 'starting again' aged 43, Kate built her dream with her own hands

image.altText: A woman looking at the camera as a child sits behind her underneath an air-conditioner on a bed on the ground.

props.synopsis: Single mum Savannah Victor says she sleeps in the lounge room with her kids to escape northern WA heat because it is the only room with air conditioning.

title.children: Public housing tenants go to extreme lengths to escape heat in northern WA

image.altText: Charles and Camilla smile as students behind them raise their arms in front of the Opera House's white sails

props.synopsis: A protest about Indigenous reparation, questions over a Republic and the Big C shadowed the King's 17th visit to Australia. But he gave it his all.

title.children: Republicans and monarchists were in the crowds clamouring to see the royal couple this week. One thing united them

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: I s'pose you think you're a bit alright at this trivia thing. Go ahead — try and impress me.

title.children: Talk a big Hard Quiz game? Time to prove how much you know

image.altText: Israeli flag and Iran flag seen together.

props.synopsis: This round of fighting between Israel and Iran might be over, but the rules have changed and things are increasingly dangerous.

title.children: Israel and Iran have stopped firing, but they have moved closer to all-out war

image.altText: Uniform and non-uniform police gathered in the middle of a road in central Geelong

props.synopsis: Police have set up a crime scene spanning hundreds of metres in the heart of Geelong as homicide detectives investigate the circumstances surrounding a fatal stabbing.

title.children: Man aged 20 dies after being stabbed in central Geelong

image.altText: Three Western Bulldogs AFLW players hug on the ground during a game.

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs hang on to beat St Kilda by the smallest possible margin but Saints are left ruing missed chances, while Carlton beat AFLW arch-rivals Collingwood and the Brisbane Lions smash the Swans.

title.children: Bulldogs end St Kilda's AFLW finals hopes with win in Ballarat thriller

image.altText: An overhead view of a surfer in the ocean.

props.synopsis: A quarter of a century since white sharks were declared vulnerable, scientists and surfers want to know whether steps to protect the predator along Australia's coasts are linked to a recent wave of attacks.

title.children: White sharks have been protected for 25 years — is that linked to recent attacks?

image.altText: A man in a black polo shirt.

props.synopsis: In a remote Northern Territory community where lunch can cost $50, residents say youths are turning to crime to fill their bellies.

title.children: 'It breaks my heart': Remote residents appeal for help to feed their families as prices soar

image.altText: A barbed wire fence with a security camera in the background

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government says it is urgently working to address the "extraordinary risks" posed by record prison overcrowding. But the union representing prison guards fears it won't be enough to improve conditions.

title.children: NT prison guards consider industrial action over record high prisoner numbers

image.altText: Five women wearing black shirts and showing their arm muscles.

props.synopsis: At a working meat factory in Melbourne's south east, a group of women are part of an arm-wrestling club aptly named "The House of Pain".

title.children: Women smash stereotypes inside meat factory's arm-wrestling club
